headline: Two women file sexual abuse complaints against Nikola founder Trevor Milton
summary: Nikola founder Trevor Milton has been formally accused of sexual abuse by two women who told police he touched them when they were 15. The allegations date back more than 15 years ago.
While the U.S. health response to the coronavirus pandemic has faced criticism, the economic response has been among the best in the world.
headline: How the U.S. economic response to the coronavirus pandemic stacks up to the rest of the world
The app getting Wall Street’s attention that makes earnings calls ‘as easy as listening to podcasts’
summary: Twenty-six-year-old Hadi Yousef launched the app Earnings Calls about four years ago, and it has grown through word of mouth. Now, it has the attention of people on Wall Street such as CNBC contributor Josh Brown.

headline: Why Stakes Are Raised in the Azeri-Armenian Conflict
summary: Conflict over Nagorno-Karabakh has broken out repeatedly since Armenians seized control of the territory and surrounding areas from Azerbaijan, in a war that started soon after the 1991 collapse of the former Soviet Union, killing more than 30,000 people and …
SpaceX CEO Elon Musk reiterated the likelihood his private space company will likely IPO its Starlink satellite internet service.
headline: Elon Musk says he likely will take Starlink satellite internet service public in 'several years'
Dow rallies 400 points, continuing Friday's gains—Three experts on what to watch
summary: Bank and tech stocks led a market rally as investors grew optimistic Congress could vote on a stimulus deal as soon as next week. Three experts discuss what the correction means and how investors should watch the market.
A new UCSF study has found that time-restricted eating, a health fad with many adherents in Silicon Valley and Hollywood, doesn't seem to help people lose weight.
headline: Intermittent fasting doesn't help you lose weight, UCSF study suggests
Here's what happened to the stock market on Monday
summary: A slew of corporate deals and optimism around a potential coronavirus deal jolted stocks to start the week.

headline: Former Amazon manager made $1.4 million from insider trading, SEC alleges
summary: The commission alleges that Laksha Bohra, who worked as a senior manager in Amazon's tax department, had access to confidential information from Amazon ahead of the company's quarterly and annual earnings reports.

headline: Google to enforce 30% cut on in-app purchases next year
summary: The announcement brings Google Play's policies in line with Apple's App Store policies, which have come under fire from developers and regulators over several issues, including its own 30% cut.

Apple has designed a reusable, disposable face mask for employees to wear during the pandemic. The face masks look like a typical Apple product, with a minimalist design and  packaging. Apple told Bloomberg that the company researched and tested effective materials that wouldn't put further strain on the supply chain for personal protective equipment.
headline: Apple engineers designed a custom face mask for employees — take a look

summary: The CDC issued guidance encouraging Americans to shop online rather than in crowded stores during the holiday season because of the pandemic.
headline: As holidays approach, CDC puts shopping at crowded stores on Black Friday in high-risk category
Virgin Galactic jumps over 20% as Street continues to recommend the space tourism company
summary: Shares of Virgin Galactic surged as much as 22% in trading Monday after Wall Street firms continued set higher expectations
The stock market is likely to see strong gains next year due to increased liquidity and an improvement in the coronavirus, the finance professor told CNBC on Monday.
headline: Wharton's Jeremy Siegel: Wall Street could boom in 2021 'no matter who is president'
Could Covid-19 be considered a preexisting condition? It's complicated.
summary: With the death of Ruth Bader Ginsburg, President Donald Trump announced Amy Coney Barrett as a new nominee to the Supreme Court, which could have a major effect on American's health-care options, particularly for those worried about getting health insurance with a preexisting condition.

headline: The U.S. is 'not in a good place' as daily coronavirus cases grow beyond 40,000, Fauci says
summary: "There are states that are starting to show an uptick in cases and even some increase in hospitalizations in some states," Dr. Anthony Fauci said on Monday.

headline: Sen. Ted Cruz: GOP will protect Americans with preexisting conditions if Obamacare struck down
summary: "Every Republican agrees we're going to protect preexisting conditions," Sen. Ted Cruz of Texas told CNBC on Monday.

Would you like to know where you can find the next trillion dollar growth stock? If so, ERShares may have an answer for you. It's an ETF with NYSE Ticker: ENTR. This ETF invests in the leading Entrepreneurial publicly listed companies around the world.

Health care is again at a political crossroads heading into the U.S. presidential election. Gina Sanchez of Chantico Global and Craig Johnson of Piper Sandler discuss the potential winners and losers in the space.
headline: Trump vs Biden: Here are the health-care stocks that could benefit from the 2020 election
Health and safety certificates may be the new 'visas' that permit air travel, Etihad CEO says
summary: Airlines will need to meet a "harmonized" standard of health measures as air travel returns, according to Tony Douglas of Etihad Airways.
